SEARCH
Package org.projectsw.Model

Class Shelf

java.lang.Object
org.projectsw.Model.Shelf
public class Shelf extends Object
Class representing a shelf with a matrix of tiles, the shelf that every player is going to use.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Shelf()
    Constructs a new empty shelf with 6 rows and 5 columns, setting as null all the other parameters.
    Shelf(int b)
    Constructs a Shelf object with the specified parameters.
    Shelf(Shelf shelf)
    Constructs a new shelf with the same contents as the given shelf.

  • Constructor Details

    • Shelf

      public Shelf()
      Constructs a new empty shelf with 6 rows and 5 columns, setting as null all the other parameters.

    • Shelf

      public Shelf(int b)
      Constructs a Shelf object with the specified parameters. Used for backdoor only
      Parameters:
      b - The parameter used to initialize the Shelf for the backdoor player.

    • Shelf

      public Shelf(Shelf shelf)
      Constructs a new shelf with the same contents as the given shelf.
      Parameters:
      shelf - the shelf to copy

  • Method Details

    • getShelf

      public Tile[][] getShelf()
      Returns the matrix of tiles that the shelf holds.
      Returns:
      the matrix of tiles

    • getSelectableColumns

      public ArrayList<Integer> getSelectableColumns()
      Returns the selectable columns attribute.
      Returns:
      the arraylist of integers containing the indexes of selectable columns.

    • getTileShelf

      public Tile getTileShelf(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns a specific tile of the shelf.
      Parameters:
      row - coordinate for the row
      column - coordinate for the column
      Returns:
      the tile at the coordinates row x column
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if row or column exceed the shelf bounds (Config.shelfHeight or Config.shelfLength)

    • getSelectedColumn

      public Integer getSelectedColumn()
      Return the selected column attribute.
      Returns:
      the int corresponding to the selected column attribute.

    • isSelectionPossible

      public boolean isSelectionPossible()
      Return the selectionPossible attribute.
      Returns:
      the boolean corresponding to the selectionPossible attribute.

    • setShelf

      public void setShelf(Tile[][] shelf) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the matrix of tiles for the shelf from the given shelf.
      Parameters:
      shelf - the shelf where the matrix of tiles is taken from
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter shelf hasn't the right dimensions (Config.shelfHeight or Config.shelfLength)

    • setSelectableColumns

      public void setSelectableColumns(ArrayList<Integer> selectableColumns)
      Sets the selectable columns attribute.
      Parameters:
      selectableColumns - the arraylist of integers to ses as new array list of integers.

    • setSelectedColumn

      public void setSelectedColumn(Integer selectedColumn) throws UnselectableColumnException
      Sets the selected column attribute.
      Parameters:
      selectedColumn - the int to set as new selected column attribute.
      Throws:
      UnselectableColumnException

    • setSelectionPossible

      public void setSelectionPossible(boolean selectionPossible)
      Sets the selection possible attribute.
      Parameters:
      selectionPossible - the boolean to set as new selection possible attribute.

    • insertTiles

      public void insertTiles(Tile tile, int row, int column)
      Inserts a tile into the specified row and column of the shelf.
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to insert
      row - the row to insert the tile into
      column - the column to insert the tile into
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row or column is out of bounds (Config.shelfHeight or Config.shelfLength)
      IllegalArgumentException - if row and column correspond to an EMPTY or an UNUSED tile

    • updateSelectableColumns

      public void updateSelectableColumns(Player player)
      Updates the selectable columns arrayList after checking the size of temporaryTiles arrayList of the player.

    • maxFreeColumnSpace

      public int maxFreeColumnSpace()
      Returns the maximum column space present in the shelf between 0 to Config.maximumTilesPickable.
      Returns:
      an int equal to the maximum column space.

    • cleanSelectableColumns

      public void cleanSelectableColumns()
      Clears the selectable columns arrayList.

    • cleanSelectedColumn

      public void cleanSelectedColumn()
      Sets as null the selectedColumn attribute.

    • printShelf

      public void printShelf()
      Prints the shelf.
